snippet.title: Surfers enjoy swell at Shellharbour, Wollongong
snippet.content:
SURFERS were again out across the Illawarra making the most of some large winter swells battering the region. Illawarra Mercury photographer Sylvia Liber photographed the locals enjoying the sets at Shellharbour on Wednesday morning.
Surfers get a swell day for it
exit Large swells have visited the region in recent days, which saw a for large parts of the NSW coastline. Conditions were expected to ease over the remainder of the week. The forecast for Thursday is showers increasing with temperatures between 10-17 degrees. The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting a mainly fine but cool weekend with light winds prevailing. READ MORE: SOUTH COAST LOCALS SURF ON DESPITE WINTER CHILLS READ MORE: TYLER WRIGHT, SALLY FITZGIBBON ADVANCE IN US OPEN HEATS READ MORE: FORMER BILLABONG AND MAMBO MODEL'S HOMECOMING
